metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1852 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The s3_token middleware in OpenStack keystonemiddleware before 1.6.0 and python-keystoneclient before 1.4.0 disables certification verification when the "insecure" option is set in a paste configuration (paste.ini) file regardless of the value, which allows remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-7144.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-keystoneclient - 1:0.7.1-ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> will not be fixed before 14.10 goes EoL

criterions.comment: python-keystoneclient package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:0.7.1-ubuntu1.2').
